title: For Sale/Trade:  Survivalist Series by Jerry Ahern
postcontent:
1-10 of the Survivalist series by Jerry Ahern. Just let me know what your offer is and we can go from there. I have read the first 10 myself and for those not familiar with the series, the books I have read so far are packed full of action. I do not know if you can go more than 10 pages without someone's life being on the line. Rating wise, the killing can be pretty graphic, I would describe the language as moderate, and there are themes that I would not recommend for children. I think the age range would be a mature 16 on up.

Like I said before, these books are action packed (sometimes to the point of ridiculousness) and deal with survival in a post nuclear war world. While there are a few parts that start to move a little slowly, these books are generally hard to put down. Let me know if you have any questions or want to know more.

Just let me know what you are willing to trade or make a cash offer. I can meet in Cedar Bluff, Turkey Creek, Hardin Valley, or Karns most days and somtimes at Mckays Used Books. Worst I will say is no thanks. Check out my other ads. Thanks for your time.

title: For Sale:  Voodoo Tactical  46" Rifle Case
postcontent:
I have a brand new Voodoo Tactical rifle case for sale.  Its brand new and still has tags on it.  Its black and holds 2 rifles and two pistols.  These cost $108 new. http://www.voodootactical.net/p-27-voodoo-tactical-46-inch-molle-soft-rifle-case-padded-weapon-bag.aspx

Mfg description-
If you like heavy metal and need something larger than our standard 42-inch rifle carrying case, than this 46-inch Voodoo Tactical brand rifle carrying case is just the ticket. It is designed to safely hold larger battle rifles, such as the FAL, AR-10, M-1 Garand, M14 and M-16s and AR-15s with 20-inch barrels. As long as your overall lenth is 45 inches or less, it should fit fine.

Inside are adjustable tie downs so that you can be sure your optics are not going to get knocked about. The attention to detail and heavy thick foam on all six sides is a welcome change from the standard nylon case. It even features additional padding to protect your muzzle and the zippers are tough enough to meet the demanding conditions required by the military and law enforcement.

Behind the pouches, there's a second compartment (which you can't see too in the photo) with two padded pouches built in. Each is designed to hold a pistol, but you could also use these for optics or other accessories.

This case comes with the three external pouches you see here, giving you plenty of storage space for magazines, boxes of ammo, cleaning kits, your log book and other accessories. The three exterior pouches have gussets, making them hold far more than you would think. The two outside pouches can hold five or six magazines and the center pouch is even larger.

This gun case features three carrying methods: A standard handle in center of the bag, a shoulder strap, and back-pack style shoulder harness. This backpack style carry is great for long distances. And if you use the PAL webbing to attach MOLLE or ALICE pouches, you can haul even more gear.

Has the markings of "COLT'S PT FA MFG CO HARTFORD CONN USA" on the right side of the barrel, has the markings "DIAMONDBACK 38 SPECIAL CTG." denoting the caliber on the left side of the barrel, the matching serial number "N07XXX" are on the inside of the frame when you open the cylinder and on the inside of the crane recess when you open the cylinder. This revolver mechanics works fine in both single and double action locking up tight with a small amount of play being in good cosmetic condition with the finish having turned to a nice even patina in most areas (as I am no expert in the grading of these just going on my opinion that defers from person to person) with the metal surface having normal handling marks and finish loss, the bore and cylinder chambers are in good condition with good lands, grooves and good rifling the entire length of the bore. The wooden grips are in good condition with normal handling marks with no visual breaks, cracks or repairs missing the ejector rod head cap/nut, but please see pics and ask questions if there is something we have not covered as we are not experts in these type of firearms. This would make a great shooter for the range, ccw gun or addition to your colt revolver collection to keep in your gun safe as these are becoming rare and harder to find in the short barrel configuration. title: For Sale:  Gibson ES-137 Custom Classic Semi Hollow LIKE NEW
postcontent:
Gibson ES-137 Custom Classic Semi Hollow LIKE NEW - $1450 (West Suburbs)

I've decided to sell a few guitars. This one is only a few months old. Rarely been played. I'm just more of a les Paul guy. I would consider another les Paul as a trade. 
The guitar is in excellent condition 
It's a 2011 custom classic model 
Comes with the original gibson case 


The ES-137 blends the looks and overall style of a single cutaway semi-hollowbody guitar and the sonic authority of a Gibson Les Paul Classic. It refines the basic design of earlier semi-hollowbody Gibsons by swapping the style's maple centerblock for solid mahogany to increase sustain and reduce feedback at even heavy metal volumes. With its single Florentine cutaway, the ES-137 Classic draws on the heritage of Gibson's earlier ES-135 and ES-175 models for historic inspiration, but sustain, sizzle, and some appealing non-traditional color options make it an absolutely contemporary instrument.

The ES-137 Classic shares Gibson 490 R and 498 T pickups with chrome and gold hardware options, including a Nashville Tune-O-Matic bridge and stopbar tailpiece. The instrument's neck is sturdy three-ply maple supporting a 22-fret rosewood fingerboard with pearloid inlays and single ply binding. It has a rounded profile and a 24-inch scale length and is 1 11/16th-inches wide at the nut. The tuners are Grover keystones. And complimenting the 490R and 498T humbuckers is the classic Gibson dual volume pot, dual tone pot, and three-way selector set configuration.

The ES-137 Classic comes strung with Gibson .010 Brite Wires and get a meticulous examination and dressing on one of the Custom Shop's state-of-the-art Pleck machines, ensuring optimum playability. With a black levant case, the ES-137 Classic leaves the Custom Shop ready to gig -- anywhere.

title: For Sale:  PARA ORDNANCE 1911 RACE FRAME PISTOL
postcontent:
I have a Para Ordnance 1911 - 16/40 Race Frame Gun, Two Tone (SS) and in beautiful condition including 3 double stack Hi Cap. mag's. I might be interested in trading for???
It is in very good condition with all Pro Shop upgrades. VALUE $1900 to 2200.
Caliber: .40 S&W
Capacity: 16+1 (21 + 1 with base pads)
Barrel l: 5” Bull
Guide rod: Full length
Length: 8.5”
Height: 5.75”
Sights: Adjustable (W+E) black Para competition rear, Fiber-optic Para competition front
Receiver: Stainless Steel
Slide: Stainless Steel 
The ever-feared race gun is generally a pistol that is designed to eliminate the competition and is a favorite modification of the Para Ordnance long slide pistols. It allows users to hand load lighter charges, ensuring both less recoil and no competition from factory pistol shooters. Despite many people criticizing these types of competitive shooters, they get results. In fact these shooters have, in many areas, cornered the competition, making other shooters emulate the very tactic they profess to despise. But like any other sport, the innovations are spread around until there are a fair amount of users to make it an everyday occurrence, rather than a display of pure dedication. Para Ordnance firearms are here to stay and poised to give Americans another great import from our all-but-forgotten neighbor to the north. I would recommend a Para Ordnance firearm to any of my clients or acquaintances. After my many years of shooting, I think these relative newcomers take competitive shooting to the next level without missing a beat. Despite the bulky price of many Para Ordnances, these firearms really are a prime example of getting what you pay for, especially when considering the lack of quality from some of the lower priced competitors. So in closing I would highly recommend any of the Para Ordnance pistols for anybody looking to smash their competition for IDPA or one of the many other popular firearms related sports.
It has all upgraded internal's including a SS Skelatonized Trigger, Match Grade Bull Barrel, SS Slide,SS Back Strap, SS Bobbed Hammer, etc. The Serial number is RF 44XX.
Thanks, Greg

title: For Sale:  Dri-Slide Weapons Lubricant
location: Apple Valley, Minneapolis / St. Paul, Minnesota
postcontent:
From their website:  Dri-Slide Weapons Lubricant promotes smooth, reliable, jam-free operation and a clean bore. Applied wet, the liquid carrier evaporates leaving a dry lubricant bonded to the metal surfaces of the weapon; as a result, dirt, dust, and sand will not stick to lubricated parts. Prevents rust and corrosion. Apply Weapons Lubricant Improved to trigger groups, bolt carriers, operating rods, slides, magazines, and barrels of pistols, rifles, and other weapons.

This stuff is really great for mechanisms where dirt-attracting oils and greases would create problems, such as revolver mechanisms and trigger groups.

Here’s an article: http://www.uniquetek.com/site/696296/uploaded/rifle_241_pgs32_37.pdf

I had to buy the minimum order of 3 bottles, so I’m selling the other two, because it lasts a long time.  You can have it for less than my cost, just $12 each.

postcontent:
Now in stock and ready to run!

Daniel Defense’s new caliber option, the 300 Blackout, was originally designed to give the shooter a 30 caliber projectile which could be fired out of the AR platform without an increase in magazine size while still utilizing a standard bolt. The 300 Blackout is 7.62x35mm which gives the shooter similar ballistic qualities as the .308 and the 7.62x39mm, the AK round, without having to give up the light weight 5.56mm/AR platform.  The 300 Blackout can still utilize standard AR magazines without a reduction in magazine capacity. title: For Sale:  1916 Model T Ford Brass radiator touring car.  One family owned since new.
postcontent: This car was purchased new in 1916 by my Great-grandfather--David Gamble who served with the 47th Alabama CSA Infantry.  He died in 1918 and the car stayed in storage with very low mileage until my Dad returned from service in 1945 and began to drive and restore the car.  It is 100% complete--nothing altered or modified--but will need complete restoration.  The upholstery and top fabric were destroyed by mice and caused some rust in the back body panels.  The original hand tools are with the car, as well as period accessories--such as a robe rail and horn and locking coil box.  Dad installed new tubes/tires on the original non-demountable wheels.  This would make an easy restoration on a low mileage original Brass era Model T Ford  REDACTED.

title: For Sale:  DPMS LR308/ Springfield Armory FFP 4-14x56 Scope 7.62 reticle
postcontent:
Price Reduced!!!!!
DPMS LR-308 W/Springfield Armory FFP 4-14x56 Scope 7.62 reticule. A great tactical rifle, this DPMS LR-308. Chambered for .308 NATO, the rifle has a host of technical features, a heavy, free-floating barrel,  The rifle is in fine to excellent condition, However it has been fired and shows handling marks. This is not a Safe Queen – that means that the finish, stocks, and the bore all rate about 90+% condition. 24" STAINLESS STEEL Heavy Barrel 1-10" Twist , A2 Stock, 8620 steel bolt carrier, Right hand ejection, 1-5 round magazine, Flat Top Picatinny Rail Receiver. Ergo tactical grip with palm shelf and Harris Bipod. 

THE LOW DOWN ON THE SCOPE
This is a Springfield Front Focal Plane scope with a range finding reticule with brackets out to 1,000 meters. Makes ranging targets quick and easy. Plus it being a Front Focal scope the hashes work for drop at any magnification, not just the highest setting like on second focal plane scopes from Leupold, Nightforce, etc. 

This is the only scope I know of with drop points in the 308 caliber.  Schmidt & Bender, US Optics, Premier Heritage, Zeiss Hensoldt, Nightforce, Leupold Mark 4's, etc. and none of them make a reticle for the 7.62x51

 This one has drop's every 100 meters from 200 to 1,000 when using 168 grain match ammo. It has an internal bubble level to make sure you are dead center before the shot. The 56mm objective is oversized and provides ample light gathering ability especially with the 30mm tube. I think this website summed it up best:

 The 1st Generation scope is ballistically tuned for 7.62 (.308) match ammo and with its large objective lens delivers superior light gathering capability, even in low light conditions. This rugged, variable power scope features slim no snag windage and elevation knobs, and is perfect for a variety of serious law enforcement, counter sniper, and hunting applications. Variable Power 4-14x56, Patented Range finding Reticule with hands free automatic bullet drop compensation for 7.62 (.308) match ammo to 1000 meters, 30mm tube and patented internal bubble level.

 Here is some more info from an old Springfield Brochuere:
Very Finest Optical Quality and Resolution Len's
Proprietary Coatings for Maximum Light Transmission
Rugged Monotube Construction
Nitrogen Filled for Fog Free Use
Permanently Centered Reticules
Shock Proof and Water Proof
Lifetime Warranty
Internal Level
Patented Range finding Reticule

 The Internal Bubble Level is a very cool feature. Did you know that as little as a 10 degree cant can put the bullet 6 feet off target at 1,000 Meters!

 The reticle is calibrated for a 168 grain bullet at 2,550 FPS. Plus some other cool info. These are loads that also very closely match the ballistics of the above 308 load. 
7.62x39 125 grain at 2,900 FPS
 30-06 Springfield 180 grain at 2,650 FPS
8mm Mauser 150 grain at 2,800 FPS
375 H&H 300 grain Boat Tail at 2,500 FPS

 You are suppose to zero the scope to be dead on at 200 meters. Once you are zero'd the small crosshairs next to the meter markings are dead on for those ranges. 

You can use the brackets of varying sizes to quickly range the target then use the yardage markers to make your shot.
